description: Leslie Knope tries to beautify her town by helping a local nurse turn a construction pit into a community park.
title: Pilot

description: Leslie and her committee try to build support for her park project; Tom uses questionable recruiting tactics.
title: Canvassing

description: Leslie asks a reporter to do a story on her project; Tom tries to kiss up to his boss.
title: The Reporter

description: Leslie faces a tough ethical choice at a casual get-together; Andy has a surprise for Ann.
title: Boys Club

description: Leslie makes an impression at a banquet honoring her mother; Mark and Tom go to a bar to pick up women.
title: The Banquet

description: Leslie goes to a meeting with a local bigwig while her subcommittee members go to Andy's first concert since breaking both his legs.
title: Rock Show

description: Hoping to promote the local zoo, Leslie arranges a penguin "wedding," but things don't go as planned when they realize the birds are both male.
title: Pawnee Zoo

description: Tom and Leslie discover marijuana planted in the community garden; Ann gets permission from Leslie to go on a date with Mark.
title: The Stakeout

description: Leslie eagerly anticipates her role as a judge in the Miss Pawnee Pageant but finds herself disagreeing with the other judges about what constitutes an ideal woman.
title: Beauty Pageant

description: Leslie, nervous about her first date with Dave (Louis C.K.), goes on a practice date with Ann; Ron, Tom, April and Mark try to find dirt on one another.
title: Practice Date

description: Leslie hosts the Parks and Recreation Department of Boraqua, Venezuela, Pawnee's sister city; Tom becomes an errand boy; April plays hard to get.
title: Sister City

description: Leslie and the rest of the department help an organization build a playground; Leslie takes advice from Mark.
title: Kaboom

description: Leslie asks Dave and Andy to help her catch a teenage vandal; Ann tries to throw a fun Halloween party.
title: Greg Pikitis

description: Leslie learns the library department, which is run by Ron's ex-wife (Megan Mullally), wants to take over her lot; Andy gets a job in hopes of winning back Ann.
title: Ron and Tammy

description: After a City Hall mural is defaced, the members of the Parks Department compete to come up with a new design; Andy and Ron share an uncomfortable moment.
title: The Camel

description: Leslie invites herself on Ron's annual hunting trip to prove that she can hang with the guys; with everyone else away, April and Andy bond in the office.
title: Hunting Trip

description: Leslie finds out that Tom is getting a divorce and tries to cheer him up, but Tom is withholding an important detail about his marriage to Wendy.
title: Tom's Divorce

description: A meeting with a disgraced councilman lands Leslie in the middle of a sex scandal; when Ron offers to cover for Leslie for a day, he quickly discovers how much work she really does.
title: Christmas Scandal

description: Ann sets Leslie up on a blind date; one of Ann's old friends makes Mark feel insecure.
title: The Set Up

description: Following a date with Justin in Indianapolis, Leslie hosts a dinner party at her house to try to impress him.
title: Leslie's House

description: Leslie objects to a deal the Parks Department forms with a local company to sell energy bars in Pawnee; Mark agrees to help Tom move.
title: Sweetums

description: Leslie and Justin reunite her mother with an old flame for Valentine's Day; Andy's band is nervous about playing a gig at the Senior Center.
title: Galentine's Day

description: Ron wins an award for a project that Leslie began; Tom needs to find money to invest in a local Pawnee club.
title: Woman of the Year

description: Leslie must catch a possum that bit the mayor's dog; Mark refuses to bend the rules for Ron.
title: The Possum

description: After Jerry is mugged in a park, Leslie meets with the head ranger (Andy Samberg) in hopes of improving safety; everyone tries to be nicer to Jerry when he returns to the office.
title: Park Safety

description: Leslie plans a picnic lunch for Ron and former directors of the Parks Department; Tom poses for the cover of the summer events catalog.
title: Summer Catalog

description: Ron becomes upset when April mistakenly schedules meetings for him; Leslie fights to preserve a historic landmark.
title: 94 Meetings

description: When she hosts the late-night shift of a local telethon, Leslie gets a former professional basketball player as a celebrity guest; Mark has big plans for his relationship with Ann.
title: Telethon

description: A visit from two state auditors (Adam Scott and Rob Lowe) puts Leslie's new park plans on hold; April has a plan for Andy.
title: The Master Plan

description: Leslie decides to take matters into her own hands when Ben (Adam Scott) stops her from holding a children's concert; Mark faces some big decisions; Andy is surprised by some romantic attention.
title: Freddy Spaghetti

description: Leslie asks Ann to help her convince Chris and Ben to give the parks department more money; Ron and Andy coach basketball; April makes an announcement.
title: Go Big or Go Home

description: Leslie comes down with the flu while planning the local Harvest Festival; Andy and Ron bond.
title: Flu Season

description: Leslie plans to bury a time capsule that summarizes life in Pawnee; Andy asks Chris for help winning April back.
title: Time Capsule

description: Tom tries to get even with Ron by going on a date with Ron's ex-wife (Megan Mullally); April is asked to work with Chris.
title: Ron & Tammy: Part Two

description: Leslie, Tom and Ben try to spread the word about the Harvest Festival; Ben faces tricky questions about his past; Andy vies for April's affection.
title: Media Blitz

description: Ron and Leslie travel to Indianapolis to receive commendation for the upcoming Harvest Festival; April and Andy learn to have fun without spending money.
title: Indianapolis

description: Leslie deals with a Wamapoke tribal leader who is threatening to put a curse on the Harvest Festival; April is upset with Andy; Ann gets some romantic advice.
title: Harvest Festival

description: Leslie takes the department on a camping trip to brainstorm new ideas; Andy tries to romance April; Chris returns to Pawnee as the city manager.
title: Camping

description: April and Andy have a dinner party; Ben turns to Leslie for career advice; Ann goes to a singles party.
title: Andy and April's Fancy Party

description: An online dating service matches Leslie with someone she already knows; Chris challenges Ron to a burger cook-off as part of a new health initiative.
title: Soulmates

description: Jerry's painting creates excitement at the community art show; Ben moves in with April and Andy; Leslie disagrees with Chris' workplace dating rules.
title: Jerry's Painting

description: When a neighboring town puts a fence around one of its parks, Leslie asks an old friend for help; Ron tries to stop his own birthday party from happening.
title: Eagleton

description: Ann's lack of enthusiasm at an offer for a city hall job causes an argument with Leslie; Tom invites everyone to help him promote his new alcoholic beverage.
title: The Fight

description: Chris sends Leslie and Ben on a trip to the capital; Ron teaches a student about his views; Tom's new game; April hurts Andy's feelings.
title: Road Trip

description: The parks department is unhappy when Chris makes big changes; Leslie is surprised when Ben has a meeting with her mother.
title: The Bubble

description: Leslie and the Parks Department organize a memorial for a dearly departed friend; Tom makes a big decision; Chris reacts poorly to a health issue.
title: Li'l Sebastian

description: Leslie must chose between Ben and her dream of running for office; Ann dispenses medical advice; Ron gets ready for the return of Tammy One.
title: I'm Leslie Knope

description: Leslie has to get involved when Ron's first wife re-enters his life and starts controlling him; Ben helps Tom with his new company; Ann makes a public service announcement with Chris.
title: Ron and Tammys

description: Leslie promotes her new book; Ann tries to bond with Ron and April.
title: Born and Raised

description: In retaliation to Ron's "guys-only" wilderness group, Leslie takes the women on an adventure weekend; Ben is forced into joining Donna and Tom for a day of relaxation; Chris spends time with Jerry.
title: Pawnee Rangers

description: April and Andy throw a Halloween party, to Ben's dismay; Tom promotes his company while emceeing a campaign event for Leslie; Ron and Ann give Andy and April an unusual gift.
title: Meet 'n' Greet

description: Pawnee residents contemplate their lives after a local group predicts the end of the world; Tom plans one last big party.
title: End of the World

description: Leslie asks Ben, Andy and April to help host a Model U.N. for the local high school; Chris asks Ann for dating advice; Ron tries to find a replacement for Tom.
title: The Treaty

description: Leslie uses her new tourist attraction to spend more time with Ben; Ron and April encourage Andy to further his education; Chris assigns a logo redesign to Tom and Jerry.
title: Smallest Park

description: Leslie and Ben defend themselves against Chris' ethics charges.
title: The Trial of Leslie Knope

description: Leslie forms a citizen action group in hope of getting some work done; everyone in the office tries to plan a Christmas gift for Leslie.
title: Citizen Knope

description: Leslie asks for help staging an event; Ben gets a new hobby; April and Andy adopt a pet.
title: The Comeback Kid

description: Leslie and Ben disagree about her campaign ad; Chris makes Ron uncomfortable; Andy and April go to the doctor.
title: Campaign Ad

description: After receiving feedback from a focus group, Leslie and Ben plan a casual bowling party; April, Jerry and Chris compete to see who can raise the most money for Leslie's campaign.
title: Bowling for Votes

description: Leslie tries to find Ann a date for Valentine's Day; Ben asks Ron to help with the scavenger hunt Leslie sent him on; Chris is upset about his love life.
title: Operation Ann

description: Leslie and Ben run into Leslie's ex (Louis C.K.) while soliciting an endorsement from the Chief of Police; Andy leads the search for a campaign theme song.
title: Dave Returns

description: After realizing everyone forgot Jerry's birthday, Leslie decides to throw him a party; Tom is shocked to learn Ann doesn't share his taste in music.
title: Sweet Sixteen

description: Leslie's opponent, Bobby Newport, hires a powerful campaign manager (Kathryn Hahn); Ron is forced to interview replacements for Leslie; an unlikely employee discovers a solution to a challenging problem.
title: Campaign Shake-Up

description: An Indianapolis talk show host asks to interview Leslie; April and Ron help ready Andy for his final exam.
title: Lukcy

description: Leslie takes action when she learns the Parks Department budget is about to be cut; Chris takes Ron to a meditation center.
title: Live Ammo

description: Leslie faces Bobby Newport in a televised debate; Ann, Tom and Chris man the media spin room; Ron works to save a party for Leslie's donors.
title: The Debate

description: An important person in Pawnee dies while Leslie is on a bus tour for the final day of her campaign; Andy investigates a security threat; Chris finds a cure for his depression.
title: Bus Tour

description: Leslie and Bobby Newport (Paul Rudd) are separated by a miniscule margin on Election Day; as everyone waits for election results, they ponder the future.
title: Win, Lose, or Draw

description: Leslie is overwhelmed when she and Andy visit Ben and April in Washington, D.C.; Ron throws a barbecue for the whole staff.
title: Ms. Knope Goes to Washington

description: Leslie passes a city-wide tax on huge sodas in hope of combating obesity in Pawnee; Chris helps Andy prepare for his police entrance exam.
title: Soda Tax

description: Leslie tries to pass a law extending the community pool hours; Chris thinks of a new way to solve people's problems around the city, which leads to Ron fixing a pothole for a local mother (Lucy Lawless); April and Ben plan a road trip.
title: How a Bill Becomes a Law

description: Leslie holds a sex-education class following an STD outbreak among senior citizens in Pawnee; when Tom's gadgets are taken away, Ron helps him acclimate to life without technology; April and Ben meet Congressman Murray.
title: Sex Education

description: Ben gets a job offer, forcing Leslie to think about their future; Ron and Andy take Diane's girls trick-or-treating; Tom looks for a new business idea.
title: Halloween Surprise

description: Leslie meets Ben's parents; Jean-Ralphio helps Tom prepare the pitch for his new business idea; Chris has mood swings.
title: Ben's Parents

description: April tries to get Lot 48 turned into a dog park, upsetting Leslie; Tom gets Ben's help with his new business idea; Andy improves his crime scene investigation skills.
title: Leslie vs. April

description: Leslie asks the public for park design suggestions but is suspicious when the best design comes from an Eagleton architect; Tom asks the office for help with his new business; Andy tries to make his job as a security guard exciting.
title: Pawnee Commons

description: Tammy II crashes a woodworking awards dinner that Ron, Diane and Leslie are attending; Jerry fails to invite some of his friends to his holiday party.
title: Ron and Diane

description: Ann plans a bachelorette party for Leslie, but Councilman Jamm derails the event; Chris has a game night at Ben's.
title: Two Parties

description: April and Leslie try to get more women hired in government; Tom asks Ben and Andy to teach him about basketball; Ron watches Diane's kids.
title: Woman in Garbage

description: After a series of unsuccessful relationships, Ann makes a decision; Ben asks Tom, Chris and Ron to help him select a caterer for the wedding; April has to complete one of Leslie's tasks.
title: Ann's Decision

description: Ben and Leslie put together a black-tie gala to raise money for the park, but a drill for a city-wide emergency derails their plans; Andy gets ready for his police academy exam; Ron fills in for Leslie on "Pawnee Today."
title: Emergency Response

description: Leslie and Ben work to complete a years-long project in two hours; Ron's temper causes trouble.
title: Leslie and Ben

description: Leslie's speech for a media event goes missing; Ben starts his new job; Ann asks someone an important question.
title: Correspondent's Lunch

description: Leslie tries to help a failing video store stay open; Chris advises Tom on dealing with a difficult employee; Ann tries to force April to be her friend.
title: Bailout

description: Ben and Leslie travel to Ben's hometown so he can accept the key to the city; Ron is sued; Chris and Ann take a compatible parenting quiz.
title: Partridge

description: Leslie decides to revamp the Animal Control Department; Ann tries to get Ron medical attention; Ben, Tom and Andy seek out donors for their charity foundation.
title: Animal Control

description: Leslie tries to get outdated laws removed from the town charter; Chris gives April and Ron management training; Ann and Ben compete for a present for Leslie.
title: Article Two

description: Leslie tries to come up with a way to commemorate Jerry's retirement; Chris and Ann get ready to have a baby; Tom worries about how Jerry's departure will affect him.
title: Jerry's Retirement

description: Ron submits budget cut proposals that upset Leslie; a big donation is made to Andy and Ben's charity; Ann helps Tom with girl troubles.
title: Swing Vote

description: Leslie commemorates her first year as a city councilor; April receives life-changing news; Tom considers a business opportunity.
title: Are You Better Off?

description: Leslie commemorates her first year as a city councilor; April receives life-changing news; Tom considers a business opportunity.
title: London, Part 1 & 2

description: Ben, Leslie and Chris meet with Eagleton city councilor Ingrid de Forest (Kristen Bell) to discuss financial matters; Ann brings April to vet school orientation; Ron tries to get off the grid.
title: The Pawnee-Eagleton Tip off Classic

description: Pawnee Parks employees are paired up with their Eagleton counterparts; Chris and Ben work on an accounting project together; Ann divulges her plans.
title: Doppelgangers

description: Leslie deals with a minor scandal; Tom tries to impress a woman; Ben talks Ron into preparing a will.
title: Gin It Up!

description: An emergency late-night filibuster forces Leslie to leave Ben's birthday party early; Tom tries to create memories with his girlfriend; Ron and Donna go hunting; April and Andy reconnect.
title: Filibuster

description: On the day of the recall vote, Leslie works on a haunted house with Ben, Chris and Ann; Tom asks Ron for help saving his business.
title: Recall Vote

description: Leslie tries to tackle some of her goals, such as hosting an event with the Indianapolis Colts and adding fluoride to Pawnee's drinking water; Chris and Ron build cribs together.
title: Fluoride

description: Leslie faces off with Councilman Jamm; Ben gets a new hobby; Tom, April and Donna help Ron sell his cabin.
title: The Cones of Dunshire

description: Leslie makes plans for her future with Ben as she comes to term with her last day in office; Ann and Chris learn the sex of their baby; Chris returns from London.
title: Second Chunce

description: Leslie and Ben start new jobs; Donna, April and Andy prank Ben; Tom readies himself for a big presentation; Ann and Chris consider the future.
title: New Beginnings

description: Leslie and Ben argue over sales techniques at the farmers market; Ann looks for a way to let off steam about the annoying parts of pregnancy; April backs Andy in a new creative venture.
title: Farmers Market

description: Leslie throws a goodbye party for Ann and Chris and tries to fulfill a promise; the guys search for a going-away gift for Chris.
title: Ann and Chris

description: Ben tries to surprise Leslie with an anniversary gift; Tom and Andy help Leslie put a positive spin on the merger; April flexes her authority as Donna's boss.
title: Anniversaries

description: Leslie's efforts to take down the wall separating Eagleton and Pawnee yield unexpected results; Ben and Tom meet with possible sponsors for the concert; Ron finds a new hobby.
title: The Wall

description: Leslie runs afoul of local shock jocks when she creates a new town slogan; Andy discovers an interesting secret about Ron while scouting for bands to play the Unity Concert; Tom, Donna and April look for a restaurant locale.
title: New Slogan

description: Leslie throws a Galentine's Day in an effort to find a new friend; Tom and Ben try to secure tents for the concert; Ron looks after Andy.
title: Galentine's Day

description: Leslie helps organize the senior prom at the high school; Andy takes April as his date, despite her objections; Ben helps Tom with music at the prom.
title: Prom

description: While the flu ravages Pawnee, Andy and Leslie must book performers for the concert; Tom looks for a sommelier for his restaurant; Ben turns to Ron for help with a personal problem.
title: Flu Season 2

description: Ben and Leslie organize a charity fund to raise money for the concert; April manages Andy's schedule; Donna turns to Ron for help with an ex-boyfriend (Keegan-Michael Key).
title: One in 8,000

description: Ben, Leslie and Chris go to San Francisco for a National Parks conference; Tom opens his restaurant; Leslie is faced with a decision.
title: Moving Up Part 1 & 2
